summary: Activity registration changes broke external calling conventions. Documentation needed for how activities are called by type-string, and error messages should list available activities when a matching activity type isn't found.
userImpact: Users cannot easily understand how to call activities externally and receive unclear errors when activity types are not found.
rootCause: Activity registration changes altered how activities are called from outside the SDK without sufficient documentation or helpful error messages.
proposedFix: Document the type-string calling convention and include available activities list in 'activity not found' error messages.
resolutionDetails: Documentation was added at nodejs.temporal.io/api/namespaces/workflow#createactivityhandle and error messages improved.
keyQuote: When we changed activity registration the way activities are called from outside of the SDK was broken/different. How that works should be documented and we should maintain compatibility going forward.
